channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Feb21st
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.1.6 ✓ dplyr 1.0.8 ## ✓ tidyr 1.2.0 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 2.1.2 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() catlovers <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dearbharat/tidyverse/main/cat-lovers.csv" cat_lovers <- read_csv(catlovers) ## Rows: 60 Columns: 3 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): name, number_of_cats, handedness ## ## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.

item.title: R Markdown CO1 RMD
item.description: library(datasets) data(iris) pkgs <- c("rstatix","emmeans","psych","tidyr","tidyverse","psych","dplyr","ggplot2","lm.beta","car","Hmisc","skimr","janitor") lapply(pkgs, library, character.only = TRUE) setwd("/Users/aman/OneDrive/Junior2/git/website_AmanShaan/content/post/2022-02-17-r-markdown-co1-rmd") Intro Code Chunks Most common Use ` (backquote) not ’ (apostophe) #Sum of 2 + 2 2+2 ## [1] 4 #Average Sepal Length mean(iris$Sepal.Length) ## [1] 5.843333 When exporting you will see both of these outputs, but will only see the last one within rmd. You can also click the x on the upper right corner of the output to remove the output.

item.title: Tidyverse2
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.1.6 ✓ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✓ tidyr 1.2.0 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 2.1.2 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() url <- 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/amanks5/tidyverse/main/hotels.csv' hotels <- read_csv(url) ## Rows: 119390 Columns: 32 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (13): hotel, arrival_date_month, meal, country, market_segment, distrib.

item.title: Introduction to GGPLOT2
item.description: #Introduction This is a demonstration of creating visualizations using ggplot 2 Starwars plot Starwars glimpse library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.1.6 ✓ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✓ tidyr 1.2.0 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 2.1.2 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() glimpse(starwars) ## Rows: 87 ## Columns: 14 ## $ name <chr> "Luke Skywalker", "C-3PO", "R2-D2", "Darth Vader", "Leia Or… ## $ height <int> 172, 167, 96, 202, 150, 178, 165, 97, 183, 182, 188, 180, 2… ## $ mass <dbl> 77.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
